resources.string: You seem to be a new user.
Let\'s take a look at everything you can do.
With only a couple of clicks.
You can also unpair devices you don\'t use with a long press.
With just a couple of clicks you can easily configure your PID.
From the three constants of the PID to the speed, the ideal on the track and even suction if it also had it.
You can calibrate the APP to instantly stop your robot just by shaking your phone or also disable it.
You can save all your settings to load them later and also delete those that you no longer need very easily.\nGoodbye to the pencil and paper!
Set how much you want each variable to change, how many changes to save in the history and more.
To find nearby BT devices press "Allow" in the following dialog box and try again.
Wait until the process is complete…
I\'s an Open-Source project of OPRobots mainly oriented to the calibration of the PID in linefollower robots or similar, although it can also be used in any project that makes use of that algorithm.
In a moment, the sensor calibration process for the emergency stop will begin. Shake the device with the force you would like to apply to stop the robot immediately.
Shake the phone to calibrate it
When the device is shaken, null values of PID and speed are sent to stop the robot in case of emergency
Extra speed control of the suction fan or other component PWM of the robot
Determines the maximum number of action lines that will be saved in the summary console
Change made in the Proportional when clicking on large arrows
Change made in the Proportional by clicking on the small arrows
Change made in the Integral when clicking on large arrows
Change made in the Integral by clicking on the small arrows
Change made in the Derivative when clicking on large arrows
Change made in the Derivative by clicking on the small arrows

Se han tomado los valores por defecto, revise los ajustes.

Select the settings you want to load

Select the settings you want to delete
